intro: Brassica amblyphylla, commonly known as the narrow-leafed mustard, is a flowering plant in the mustard family, Brassicaceae. It is characterized by its small, yellow flowers and pinnately lobed leaves. Native to southern Europe and parts of Asia, it thrives in temperate climates. The plant typically grows to a height of about 30–60 cm and produces small, round seeds. It is often found in disturbed soils and can be invasive in certain regions.
